title: How to rewild your life, one (barefoot) step at a time
text:
It’s early on Monday morning – the chilliest day yet of autumn – and I’m about to plunge into a frigid Hampstead Heath pond. Fine for the seasoned septuagenarians who inhabit these waters year-round; not for the mollycoddled millennial.

But I can’t say no. I’m with fitness coach Tony Riddle who, at 44, is as hardy as they come. He’s not top-heavy like some personal trainers; his lithe, sinewy body is built for running, jumping, hanging, climbing, squatting and swimming. Rather than plodding like the average jogger, he glides.

Riddle describes himself a “natural life-stylist”. Our bodies, he argues, are unsuited to the modern world. We spend too much time indoors, hunched at desks, wreaking havoc...
description: It’s early on Monday morning – the chilliest day yet of autumn – and I’m about to plunge into a frigid Hampstead Heath pond.
